loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms Razia, a 31-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and children, has been doing hand embroidery work for about five years with the support of her husband, the man shown in the photo. Both work together and make beautiful patterns for the people of their community. Their designs are much in demand, and they earn enough to manage their household expenses.

To meet the demands of their customers without fail, Razia has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy threads in various colors with packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishing her designs. She hopes to increase their net income by fulfilling the orders on time. This will be her fifth loan, and she has shown a good repayment history.

Razia aspires to a bright future for her children and desires to build her own house, as they are currently living in a rented house.

loans.use: to buy threads in various colors with packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishing her designs.

loans.name: Manduara Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité  Manduara Poty, se conformó con la iniciativa de la señora Rumilda;  Actualmente se encuentran  en el 3er ciclo, con 13  integrantes, queda a 40 km de Curuguaty , en una de las localidades mas remotas, es una zona de difícil acceso.
Rumilda, una de las integrantes, cuenta que tiene una mini despensa, ahí trabaja desde muy temprano, y de esa forma se gana la vida. Cuenta que todo lo que hace es por su familia, es por ellos que se esfuerza y día a día trata de esforzarse más. Quiere que en un futuro no muy lejano, su vecindario mejore, teniendo mayor seguridad para los niños y las familias.
Solicita de este crédito para pode invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, verduras, frutas. Productos a granel y demás, ya que son los que mas venta tiene.
texts.en:
The Manduara Poty communal bank was started with the initiative of Rumilda. Now they are on their third loan cycle, with 13 members. They are 40 km from Curuguaty, in a more remote area that is very difficult to access. 

Rumilda, one of the members, says that she has a mini-food store. She works there starting early in the day, and this is how she makes her living. She says that everything she does is for her family. She works for them and she works harder every day. In the not-too-distant future, she wants her neighborhood to improve and be safer for children and families. She is asking for this loan to buy things for her store, like soft drinks, vegetables, fruits, bulk goods, and more, since those are the things that sell the most.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, vegetables, fruits, bulk goods, and more.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es  productor de leche la cual  entrega a una empresa de acopio,  vive en casa propia junto a su familia en la comunidad de Cota Cota del municipio de Pucarani a dos horas de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado de raza mejorada las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas de la época.
.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento, ladrillos, etc. Así podrá  refaccionar el establo para ganado, por lo tanto mejorar su producción, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.
El sueño de Edwin  es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Edwin has a dairy farm; he sells the milk he produces to another business. He lives in his own home with his family in the community of Cota Cota, in the municipality of Pucarani (two hours away from the city of La Paz). He has various purebred heads of cattle, which need better care given the harsh weather conditions. 

He has requested a loan to buy construction materials like, cement, bricks, etc. This will allow him to renovate the barn where his cattle are kept, which will in turn help to improve production because his cows will be in better health. 

Edwin's dream is to increase the number of cattle he has. This is the second loan that he has taken out through IMPRO, and the first time he has received a loan through KIVA.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate the barn where he keeps his cattle, so that they will stay warm this winter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase musical instruments.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel tiene 55 años de edad, es casado, es albañil contratista, su esposa la señora Norma  de 44 años de edad se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, viven en la Ciudad de Villarrica, tienen 5 hijos, tres mayores ya independientes, y dos menores estudiantes.
El señor Daniel empezó siendo ayudante albañil desde los 18 años de edad, con el tiempo fue adquiriendo experiencia y ahora se desempeña como contratista independiente, realiza trabajos de construcción de vivienda en general y de esa forma y gracias a su trabajo sus hijos han crecido y son personas de bien.
Daniel solicita de este crédito para la compra de una mejor mezcladora, ya que le será de mucha ayuda para poder cumplir mejor con sus trabajos y agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en: Daniel, 55, is married. He is a contract bricklayer. His wife Norma, 44, works selling cosmetics. They live in the city of Villarrica, and have five children, three older children who are independent, and two younger children who are studying. Daniel started as a bricklaying assistant when he was 18. Over time, he gained experience and now he works as an independent contractor. He does general construction work on homes and thanks to this work, his children have grown and they are respectable people. Daniel is asking for this loan to buy a better mixer, since it will help him do his job better. He is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy a mixer.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El Señor Oscar tiene 43 años de edad, es soltero, tiene un Restaurant en la ciudad de Villarrica, el cual tiene mucha clientela y es muy concurrido y conocido por todos.
Esta actividad inicio hace tres años, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de minutas en su casa, pero con el transcurso del tiempo fue creciendo y ahora alquila un local en el cual es un “Restaurant, comedor y parrillada” además ofrece el servicio de delivery.
El señor Oscar es una persona muy trabajadora y que siempre tiene miras al crecimiento, es por eso que solicita de este crédito para comprar una máquina para la elaboración de Lomito Árabe y así ofrecer la mayor variedad, calidad y buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en: Oscar, 43, is single, and has a restaurant in the city of Villarrica. His restaurant has many customers and is well-known and oft-visited by everyone. He started this activity three years ago. Before, he sold food from his home, but with time, he grew, and now he rents a space that is a "restaurant, dining hall, and grill". It also offers delivery service. Oscar is a very hard-working person, and he is always looking to grow. This is why he is asking for this loan to buy a machine to make "lomito árabe" (shawarma/gyros) and offer his customers the best variety, quality, and attention.

loans.use: to buy a machine to make "lomitos árabes" (gyros/shawarma).

loans.name: Dúo Las Golondrinas Chimaltecas Group

texts.es:
DUO LAS GOLONDRINAS CHIMALTECAS
LA SEÑORITA ESTHER DE 21 AÑOS DE EDAD ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE REFACCIONES, YA QUE ES DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y  POR LA FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICOS NO ESTUDIO, PERO AHORA ELLA ESTA LUCHANDO PARA TENER SU PROPIO NEGOCIO Y CAPITAL YAQUE ELLA DESEA TENER UN NEGOCIO MAS GRANDE Y AUMENTAR SU CAPITAL YAQUE GRACIAS A DIOS SU NEGOCIO LE ESTA  DEJANDO BONITA GANANCIA Y LA VENTA ES A DIARIO YA TIENEN SUS CLIENTES Y ESO LE AYUDA A SOLVENTAR SUS NECESIDADES ECONOMICAS. ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PARA LA ELABORACION DE REFACCIONES.
texts.en: Esther is 21 years old, and is a member of the 'Duo las Golondrinas Chimaltecas' group. She makes a living selling snacks. She comes from a disadvantaged background, and because of lack of funds she was not able to study. However, now she is fighting to have her own business and capital, she would like to expand her business and increase her capital. Thanks be to God, her business is now producing good profits and she is selling food daily. She has a strong customer base, which helps her to cover her expenses. She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients to make the food she will sell.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Amna

texts.en: Ms. Amna is a 37-year-old, energetic married woman. For the last three years, she has been doing a business of manufacturing "waan" which is a material used in making charpoy (a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan). She offers various kinds of waan in different colors, and she is famous in providing good quality waan in her community. In this way she is able to manage the needs of her family members. Her husband is a labor worker whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of his family members. She requires improving her business so she applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a new waan making machine to provide better quality material. She wishes to utilize part of the revenue for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new waan-making machine to provide better quality material.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Ms. Nasreen is 38 years old. She is a vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past 22 years. Two of her daughters also assist her in making beautiful patterns. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. Her embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of five children, all of whom are going to school. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins, and pearls in large quantities as well as packs of glittering material in various colors. She is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would like to teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business and to also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins, and pearls in large quantities as well as packs of glittering material in various colors.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Ms Shamim is a 38-year-old, energetic, married woman. For the last three years, she has been in the business of manufacturing "waan" which is a material used in making charpoy (a bed consisting of a frame strung with tapes or light rope). She offers various kinds of waan in different colors, and she is famous in providing good quality waan in her community. In this way, she is able to manage the needs of her family members. Her husband also assists her in making waan and then supplying to the people of their community and in local market. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are school-going. She requires improving her business so she applied for a loan of 33,000 PKR to buy another waan-making machine for her husband to assist her in his free time. While speaking to a loan officer at Kashf, she said her children have never slept without having a meal ever since she started working on her own. She wishes to utilize part of the revenue for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy another waan-making machine for her husband to assist her in his free time.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Ms. Samina is a 33-year-old married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past three years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong.  However, business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is working as labor worker in the power looms, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. She is a mother of three children, two sons and one daughter. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet increasing demand. According to Samina, she faced many problems during her early married life and was not able to cover the expenses of the family alone, but her business helped her to contribute in the family income and she is very much satisfied. She intends to use the profits on her children’s well-being and education.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet increasing demand.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 41-year-old mother from in Kisumu city within western part of Kenya. She supports two people in her family, and she is married to Samuel who is a businessman. He also provides support to the family. They have two children who are 16 and 12 years old respectively.

She has a retail shop, a business she has had for the last two years, and makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES. She has applied for her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more stock of sugar, salt, cooking oil, and maize flour for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

She has a dream of becoming a successful business lady and supporting her family.

loans.use: to increase the stock of sugar, salt, and cooking oil in her retail shop

loans.name: Nelson Guillermo

texts.es:
Nelson tiene 76 años de edad es casado vive con la esposa en el Cantón Chimbo  Provincia Bolívar.

Nelson se dedica a la adquisición de electrodomésticos como televisor plasma.

   Solicita el préstamo para la compra de televisor plasma y otros bienes para el hogar. 

  Las compras lo realizan en la Ciudad de Chimbo  cada semana.

 Su sueño es seguir viviendo y disfrutar con los  hijos.

 El desafío que enfrena es esperar que algún día haya suba de sueldo.

 En el tiempo libre le  gusta pasear con la familia y los nietos.
texts.en:
Nelson, 76, is married and lives with his wife in the canton of Chimbo in the province of Bolívar. He makes a living selling electrical appliances, such as plasma televisions. 

He has applied for this loan to buy plasma televisions and other home goods. He makes purchases in the city of Chimbo every week.

His dream is to continue living and to enjoy time with his children. The challenge which he faces is waiting for his salary to increase someday. In his free time, he likes to take walks with his family and his grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy plasma televisions and other home goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, lard, and butter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Ms. Abida is a 34-year-old married woman. For the past 15 years, she has been successfully running a wood sale business. She sells wood to the people of her community, as they use it in making the handles of knives, furniture and for burning purposes. 

Over time, Abida has become famous in her area for providing good quality wood of different types. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband is a laborer whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family alone. 

Abida is requesting a loan of Rs. 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to purchase bundles of wood of good quality with some cutters. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wood of good quality with some cutters.

loans.name: Lucelinda

texts.en:
Lucelinda is a retailer/dealer of food supplements. She lives in the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. 

Lucelinda has been in the business for more than a year now. This is the source of her income. Lucelinda is asking for a loan to increase her stock of food supplements. With this, she will be able to sell more products to her customers, thus augmenting her sales and income. 

In the future, Lucelinda hopes to expand her business and make it a success so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food supplements.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Doña Nelly es Casada y tiene tres hijos, quienes ayudan a sus padres, viven en casa familiar, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz.
Nelly estudió peinados en un instituto superior de belleza  y trabajó durante 10 años en este rubro en un salón de belleza propio. Luego, se dedicó a la venta de comida preparada y actualmente volvió  al salón de peinados y al cuidado de su esposo que está en tratamiento médico por una enfermedad de artritis; Nelly trabaja todos los días de la semana, en el salón de peinados manicure y tintes, Nelly mantiene a la familia en su alimentación, vestimenta, y servicios básicos.

El crédito lo requiere para mejorar e incrementar sus herramientas de trabajo en el salón de peinados que funciona en la misma casa donde vive en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz (comprará un par de tijeras nuevas, capas, peines, líquido desinfectante, etc.).
 
El sueño que tiene Nelly es de implementar el salón de peinados con el que cuenta ya que es su ingreso principal y que el esposo se pueda recuperar de su enfermedad. Así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
 
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Nelly is married with three children, who help their parents. They live in a family home, located in the area of Achachicala in the city of La Paz.

Nelly studied hairdressing at a beauty institute and worked in this field for ten years in her own beauty salon. Later, she made a living selling prepared food. She recently returned to working in her own hair salon and began to care for her husband, who is in medical treatment for arthritis.

Nelly works every day in her salon, offering haircuts, manicures, and hair color. She maintains her family with food, clothing, and basic services.

She needs this loan to improve and increase her working tools in the hair salon, which she runs from her home in Achachicala, La Paz. She will buy a new pair of scissors, gowns, combs, disinfectant, etc.

Nelly's dream is to implement the hair salon which she has, as it is her main source of income, and for her husband to recover from his illness. She will then be able to improve her family's quality of life.

This is the third time that she has applied for a loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy scissors, gowns, combs, and other items for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Samyia

texts.en:
Ms. Samyia is 30 years old and a married woman; she is striving to meet the demands of her family members such as food, clothing, and health concerns. Her husband is employed in a private job but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. 

Samyia started her business of sewing to contribute to the family income. She is well familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community.  She requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors with packs of buttons, needles etc. Then she would be able to meet the demand of her customers without fail.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors with packs of buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Uzi

texts.en:
Uzi is a married woman and is blessed with three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments in the future. She dreams of expanding into a café business. 

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour,  maize flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is 45 years old and lives with his wife and their three children. He started the business as a small store selling chips from his house. Soon, when he saw that demand was growing, he decided to invest some capital to grow the store.  

Elchin has eight years of experience in this business. His small store is located in his yard, which is located at his house. His wife helps him to sell products, and from this business his monthly profit is 200 AZN.

Nowadays, Elchin needs 2,000 AZN. He will use the loan to buy the products that sell the best, such as rice, sugar, beans, eggs, dairy products, lunch meats, and other items. This will help him increase his inventory. Sales will increase because the products that customers request will be there when they’re needed. This will allow his family to have more stability in life.

Elchin has a good loan history, and this is his fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy the products that sell the best.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is still practicing mixed crop farming, which is doing so great. Her earnings have increased to KES 12,300. 

Margaret is now requesting her second loan term to purchase more seedlings and fertilizer for this planting season.

She still hopes to open a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is a 36-year-old single man. He is living on his own. He’s an independent hard worker who strives to work under pressure in order to live a respectable life. 

Mike spent the last five years in his bakery, preparing delicious food. He is well known in his town and people visit him from all over the neighboring areas. He always wanted to better develop his business and improve his work, but until now he earns a barely fair income. For that reason, he decided to take a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a new oven.

 He confirms that the loan will help him increase his sales, and thus his income, by 15%. And as Mike is a single man, he wishes to get married and have his own family and children.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven.

loans.name: Sladana

texts.en:
Sladana is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is twelve years old, and the youngest is seven. They all live in a minority community in Kosovo. Sladana works as a nurse, and her husband works at an energy company.

The family lives in a new house, but they couldn’t manage to finish building it. Sladana and her husband don’t earn enough to support the needs of the family. The money they have generated, through salaries, is not enough to finish their house. The loan that Sladana is requesting is to buy construction materials to finish the toilet and other rooms. Her goal is to finish the house, to have a bigger space and offer better security for her family. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy construction materials, to finish building the toilet and other rooms of her family's home

loans.name: Zongolica Group

texts.en:
Susana, Panfilo and Federico live in a remote indigenous community in the Zongolica region of Veracruz. The region is very mountainous and with complicated terrains, and they have lacked electricity access since their community was established. They live on agriculture and rely on candles and diesel lamps for lighting. This is Susana’s story:

Susana is a 23-year-old woman that lives with her family in the community of Aguaje Chico, located in the state of Veracruz. With her loving husband, she supports a family of 6 by pealing and drying coffee beans. She is also in charge of her household, a task that she gladly takes care of with the help of her sons and daughters. 
Susana´s household has no access to the electric grid, so for a long time Susana has been working with coffee beans using lighting sources such as candles and diesel lamps, which that are un healthy and expensive. 
Susana and her husband depend on coffee prices that have decreased during the past few years. The variability of general prices generates a sense of economic vulnerability that Susana might be able to face by increasing the amount of coffee beans she peals and dries. She will be able to this by using a solar home system that will substitute hazardous lighting sources and will allow her to save money. The solar home system will benefit her productivity and will also allow her children to do their academic activities for more hours during night-time.

loans.use: purchase a solar home system that will allow her to stop relying on candles that are used to produce coffee

loans.name: Zongolica 2 Group

texts.en:
Gregorio (48) and his neighbors Rosendo (71) and Daniel (63)  live in Colonia Modelo, a small 20 home indigenous community in the mountainous sierra of Zongolica, in the state of Veracruz. They do not have access to electricity and even though they have asked the local authorities for support, their community is not eligible for grid extension. The three of them work cultivating coffee as their main economic activity, and believe that lighting can increase their productivity and income. 

Here is Gregorio’s story:
Gregorio is 48 and father to 3 little boys that like himself, are going to inherit the craft of producing coffee. Gregorio´s family has been producing coffee for over 3 generations in the community of Colonia Modelo in the state of Veracruz. Gregorio uses hazardous lighting sources like candles and diesel lamps to peal and clean coffee beans and then to bag mature coffee into a costal ( a type of sack). Because coffee prices have decreased, Gregorio has to be more productive, and a solar home system will allow him to do so. For Gregorio, the education is also very important, so having a clean lighting source will allow his children to study for more hours during the nighttime.

loans.use: buy a solar home system that will increase his coffee production.

loans.name: Zongolica A Group

texts.en:
Leonardo, Mario and Maria Diega live in Aguaje Chico, a small indigenous community that is 1.5 hours away from the nearest rural town through a complicated road. They are relegated from society and development, having the nearest electrical post over 4 km. away. This is Leonardo’s story:
Leonardo and his family before him have always been dedicated to agriculture. For generations they have been working as peasants, earning their income through their harvests in the community of Aguaje Chico in the state of Veracruz. When there is work, Leonardo mentions, they earn around 6 USD per day, however this happens 3-4 times a week. 
As a father of 4 children, Leonardo and his loving wife have struggled to have regular income, and to provide what is necessary for their children´s development. In addition, the lack of energy access limits them in many ways; he uses 2-3 candles every day, costing up to 20 USD every month (representing up to 20-25% of his monthly income).  Leonardo considers that spending time with his family is one of the most important things in life, and for years they have used hazardous lightning sources in their household. By obtaining a solar home system, Leonardo and his family will be able to save money, spend quality time together and have healthier lifestyle.

loans.use: acquire a solar home system for her household.

loans.name: Zongolica Veracruz Group

texts.en:
Filiberto and Teresa live in a remote rural community in the Zongolica Sierra of Veracruz. The beautiful landscapes and mountainous region is home of one of the most marginalized regions in Mexico. They have lived without electricity since they were born, and the federal electricity commission has no grid extension plans due to the small size and geographical conditions of their community. 
Filiberto is a 26-year-old man that recently became a father. With his loving wife, Filiberto takes care of their young boy and loves spending quality time with them. For years, Filiberto learned the craft of agriculture and he works his fields by producing coffee and corn in the community of Colonia Modelo, Veracruz. 
In Filiberto´s household, they have always used hazardous lightning sources like diesel lamps that consume more than 2 liters weekly, at over 1 USD / liter, they spend roughly 8-10 USD / month and have to travel long distances to obtain this polluting source of energy, impacting directly on the family´s ability to save their already limited income. 
By acquiring a solar home system, Filiberto`s believes that his family will be able to spend quality time together, increase their health standards and use a sustainable lightning source for their activities after sunlight, and even believes his wife will be able to cook better meals.

loans.use: purchase a solar home lighting system.

loans.name: Aguaje Chico, Veracurz Group

texts.en:
Felipe lives in a home of 3, while Constantino and Susana provide for a family of 5. They, as nearly 600,000 Mexican families, live without access to electricity. Almost two hours away from the rural town of Zongolica through a curvy and dirt road, you can find Aguaje Chico, a community with less than 100 inhabitants that lives in extreme poverty. 
Felipe is 32 and recently got married. His wife and him have a son who is still a baby and they live happily in the community where they grew up and where they learned the craft of agriculture. Like themselves, their families have always been peasants and they have inherited a powerful bond from working in the fields.
Felipe harvests coffee and lives from the sales he makes, but recently the prices have gone down, affecting their household economy. 
As many people in their community, Felipe uses hazardous lightning sources such as candles and diesel lamps to light up his household and spend time with his baby boy. 
By acquiring a solar home system, Felipe will be able to spend more quality time with his family and to promote a healthier environment for his baby to grow up in.

loans.use: acquire a high quality solar home LED lighting system.

loans.name: Mercedes' Group

texts.en:
Mercedes, Bulmaro and Tomás are relatives and they live in Brazo Seco, Misantla. They live in a small community located in the state of Veracruz, a location that is constantly isolated due to the lack of quality roads that flood during the rainy season. They work on the harvest of products like corn, beans and coffee. 

Mercedes is a 52 year-old woman that has dedicated her life to the care of her family. She works in her household and also helps in the harvests, a craft that she learned since childhood. 
Even though Mercedes loves working in the fields, she acknowledges that her entire family suffers from the vulnerability of food prices, so she would love to help and make their lives more confortable and less economically strained, by acquiring a solar home system. This will enable her to replace hazardous lighting sources like candles and diesel lamps that are unhealthy, expensive, and that require a considerable effort for the family to purchase. 
The family will use the solar home system to prepare their meals and share more quality time together, as well as improving their health by not inhaling smoke from diesel lamps and candles.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system to stop relying on candles.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul used the previous loan to buy stock to sell. He is a 61-year old married man with children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a pub which he started ten years ago using personal savings. His major challenge is inadequate capital to purchase inventory while his dream is to educate his children up to university level and to move the business to a more permanent location. Paul intends to use the loan to buy more crates of beer and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and sodas.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a single woman and has been blessed with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall business, selling food stuff like wheat flour, maize flour, rice and cooking oil to local customers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is married with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a very hardworking farmer who also operates a pharmacy. He has been in the business for 20 years and the rural population are his major market but he also transports the surplus to the city. He began the business with an intention of getting monthly family income. His hope for the future is to have a bigger shop and farm as well as an educated family despite the prolonged rainy seasons that make roads impassable. Samuel intends to use the loan to pay workers who are weeding his garden and to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to pay workers for weeding and to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 34 years old, a widow from Kisumu city, and a mother of two children aged 13 and 17. She is selling fruit, a business she has been doing for the last 10 years and makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. She has applied for her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business. She is hoping to become a successful business lady and to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables to re-sell

loans.name: Solidario Sembradoras De Sacatepequez Group

texts.es:
solidario sembradoras de Sacatepequez
Este solidario está conformado por doña Odilia, ella tiene 54 años de edad, tiene tres hijos a su cargo de 15 13 y 17 años respectivamente, doña Odilia se dedica a la agricultura desde ya hace varios años, como siembra de ejote arveja china, suchini entre otros productos, ella está solicitando su crédito para la compra de abono y semilla de suchini, su deseo es seguir creciendo en sus cultivos porque su idea es entregar un buen producto a sus clientes y mejor el nivel de vida de sus hijos y de ella ya que los tres están estudiando el nivel diversificado,ella espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado para poder salir adelante en su negocio y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Solidario Sembradoras de Sacatepequez

This group is formed by Odilia, who is 54 years old and has three dependent children of 15, 13 and 17 years of age. Odilia has been working in agriculture for several years, planting snow peas, zucchini, among other products. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and zucchini seeds. She wants to keep growing her crops because her idea is to deliver a good product to her customers and better the standard of living for her children since all three are studying at different levels. She hopes that you can help with the loan requested so she can to get ahead in her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for agriculture.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 50 años de edad es soltero vive con su madre en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar comunidad Santa 

Rosa de Cerritos.



Alfredo es integrado a la ventanilla VRC  de San Isidro se encuentra formado en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de 

Cerrito de una distancia de 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa son personas que se dedican a la 

agricultura y crianza de animales. 



Alfredo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de frejol y maíz y a la crianza de animales como el ganado. 



Solicita el crédito para la compra  de ganado.



 La compra lo realiza en la ciudad de Chillanes.


 El sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando y tener una buena producción. 



Los desafíos que se enfrenta es las plagas y las enfermedades falta de capital para trabajar.



 En el tiempo libre le gusta salir al pueblo a pasear y salir a  las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 50 years old and single. He lives with his mother in Chillanes in the Bolivar province in the Santa Rosa de Cerritos community.

Alfredo is a member of the San Isidro communal bank in the Santa Rosa de Cerritos community. It is 40 minutes from the head office. The members of this communal bank work in agriculture and raise animals.

Alfredo works in agriculture growing corn and beans. He also raises animals like cattle. 

He is requesting the loan to buy cattle.  He will make the purchase in the city of Chillanes.

His dream is to have his health in order to continue working and getting a good production.  The challenges he faces are pest infestations, diseases, and the lack of capital for work.

In his free time he likes to take walks in his town and go to the community celebrations.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Florence is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish paste). She usually sells her ‘Banku’ in Hotopo, near Takoradi. She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ for two years. Florence is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Florence wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Banku’. In the long term, Florence plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize

loans.name: Calvin

texts.en:
Calvin is 33 years old from Vihiga county which is found in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Christine who is a farmer, and they have three children aged one, three and six years old respectively.

He sells cereals within their market as the main source of income. He has been doing this for the last 15 years and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES 5,600. He is taking his fourth loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase maize, beans, groundnuts and millet for resale. 

He has a dream of owning a cereal company and educating his children.

loans.use: to purchase maize, millet and other cereals to re-sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is widow and has five children. Even though she did not receive any formal education,  Ekua is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells ‘Banku’ for a living. Banku is a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish paste. She normally sells her Banku in Hotopo, near Takoradi. She has been actively involved in this business for about five years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ekua uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ekua will use the loan to aid her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business,  Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick still operates his transport business. With the financial help he obtained from KADET LTD and Kiva, he was able to improve his transport business and also bought some dairy cows with the profits. He now sells milk on the side to supplement his income. He is requesting a third loan to buy a dairy cow to expand his milk selling business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Ignacia es  productora de leche la cual  entrega a una empresa de acopio,  vive en casa propia junto a su familia en la comunidad de Akerana del municipio de Achacachi a dos y media  horas de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado de raza mejorada las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas de la época.
.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento, ladrillos, etc. Así podrá  refaccionar el establo para que el ganado se mantenga caliente, por lo tanto mejorar su producción, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.
El sueño de Ignacia es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, cuidarlas mejor para que su producción de leche sea mejor.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Ignacia's business produces milk, which she then delivers to a collection company. She lives in her own home with her family in the community of Akerana in the town of Achacachi, around two and a half hours from the city of La Paz. She has several heads of cattle of an improved breed, which need better care given the weather conditions of the season.

The loan is needed to buy building materials: cement, bricks, etc. This way, she can repair the barn to keep the cattle warm, therefore improving their production and preserving the health of her cows. Ignacia's dream is to increase her herd and to take better care of them for better milk production.

This is the second time she is requesting a loan with Impro and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair the cattle barn to keep them warm and improve their milk production.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 32-year-old man from Mamboleo in Kisumu city. He supports two children in his family and is married to Benter who is a business lady. His elder child is five years old and the other one is four months old.

He owns a hardware shop in Mamboleo Market, a business he has been running for the last nine years. He makes a monthly income of KES 8,000. He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase oil paint, nails and other building materials for resale at his hardware shop. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business and pay school fees for his children.

He has a dream of stabilizing his business so as to help him generate more income to support his children by giving them the best education in their lives.

loans.use: purchase stock of oil paints, nails and other building materials to re-sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with one child, who is too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, Amina has operated a business of making fruit juices from home to sell. She faces the challenge of seasonality in fruits. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers’ needs.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase fruits for making fruit juices to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits for making fruit juice to sell.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a charcoal and firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Dorothy dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase five sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of charcoal and firewood to re-sell

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is a 61-year-old, married man and a member of John's Group. The group membership is six, including Evelyn, Rose, Dora, Badu, Agnes and John.

John sells foodstuffs (cassava, fish, tomatoes and plantains), his income source for about eight years, now. He joined this group in 2009 and, since 2010, ID-Ghana has supported him with loans. This is his third loan, and he needs Kiva’s support in the amount of 1,000 Ghanaian cedis (GHS). He will use the loan to help him increase his stock of foodstuffs. The profits from his business will go toward savings, food, and supporting his grandchildren's education.

loans.use: To buy more cassava, fish, tomatoes and plantains, which he will resell to his customers.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 32 years old. He lives in Gori district with his 29-year-old brother and parents. George requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. George trades headstones.  He purchases from re-sellers in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia, at wholesale prices and brings it to the Gori district. Headstones are sold from his house to the villagers, and George gets a small monthly salary, which is the only source of the income of the family. 

George requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, George will open a shop that specializes in headstones. 

As George already has a commercial space, he will economize on renting expenses. With the shop George will be able to keep more stock of headstones and serve more clients. This will significantly increase his income. Part of the profit will be used for reinvesting in order to expand his business, and another part will be used for covering the family's monthly expenses.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a shop that specializes in headstones.

loans.name: Danielle Pierina

texts.es:
Danielle es una mujer de 23 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que ella es padre y madre para él; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo al Horno para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Danielle trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende prendas de vestir tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, Danielle puede trabajar por un aproximado de 9 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Danielle se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir sus gastos de estudios, ya que desea matricularse, pagar la inscripción y comprar los materiales de estudios de una pequeña carrera técnica de Enfermería, la cual desea iniciar para poder superarse, así pues Danielle seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Danielle is a 23-year-old woman, she is single, lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona with her parents and small son, whom she loves and is her main reason in life.

She is a friendly hardworking and enthusiastic person, who makes a big effort to get ahead with her small son, since she is a single parent; unfortunately due to lack of economic resources and the need to work, she has not been able to study a professional career, but she would like to be able to do so.

In her spare time likes to watch films and in some occasions prepare a delicious baked-chicken to share with your family. 

On her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Danielle works in her small business selling clothes, she sells clothing for men, women and children. Danielle works by approximately 9 hours. She thinks that the business is going well because of the good prices and friendly the treatment that provides to the clients. 

Danielle is very grateful to Kiva, as thanks to the assistance provided will be able to cover the costs of her studies. She wants to enroll, pay the registration and purchase materials for the study of Nursing, a technical career. She wants to study to be able to get ahead. so Danielle will continue to work and to strive for his great dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to cover the costs of her studies

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María,  se dedica a vender ropa de forma ambulante y tambien posee una tienda general. Ella vive con su familia, su esposo y su hijo de 3 años de edad; no posee familiares en el extranjero.  María, aprendió el negocio con su familia y lo realiza de lunes a sábado, no tiene ninguna dificultad para llevarlo a cabo.
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería tales como: camisas, ropa interior, entre otras para ofrecerle a los clientes diversidad de prendas para el vestir. Este le ayudara para adquirir la mercadería, tener mayor inventario y así generar más venta.
Su sueño es obtener mejores ingresos para brindarle una mejor estabilidad de vida a su familia y poder reconstruir la vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria makes rounds selling clothes and also has a general store. She lives with her family - her husband and her 3-year-old. She does not have relatives abroad. Maria learned the business with her family and works from Monday to Saturday, with no difficulty in doing so.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise such as shirts, underwear, etc. to offer customers a variety of garments to wear. This will help her to purchase the goods, have more inventory and thus generate more sales. Her dream is to earn a better income to provide a better stability of life for her family life and to rebuild their home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
After graduating middle level school,  Gloria  decided to set up her own beauty salon business in Hotopo (near Takoradi). With over three years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more hair cream, hair extensions and a hair dryer to make her work easier. 

She aims to use the profits from her business to help support  the upkeep of her house whilst ensuring that her five children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more hair cream, hair extensions and a hair dryer to make her work easier.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with five school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over six years, she has operated a fish-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she sells food stuffs, which makes up her other source of income. She faces the challenge of price fluctuations in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, Salama wants to purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes de 60 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 18 años, es una mujer trabajadora, que siempre le ha gustado salir adelante para darle lo mejor a su familia, es humilde y muy emprendedora, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maiz y el frijol con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas como semillas, abonos, fertilizantes entre otras cosas y para darle una mejora a su terreno para poder seguir con sus cosechas y a la vez poderle dar un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en: Mercedes, 60, lives with her ​​husband and 18 year old son. She is a hardworking woman who has always liked to get ahead to give the best to her family. She is humble and very entrepreneurial and has been working in agriculture for the last several years. The main crops are corn and beans, the sales from which cover their household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies like seeds, manure and fertilizers, among other things, to improve the land so she can continue with her crops and at the same time be able to provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials such as seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema has operated a fruit juice selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to expand her business in the near future.

 With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of mangoes and passionfruit for making fruit juice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of mangoes and passionfruit for making fruit juice.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela tiene 60 años de edad es casada vive con su esposo en el cantón Chimbo Provincia Bolívar.


 
Adela se dedica a la siembra de maíz, trigo, etc. 


Solicito el crédito para adquirir insumos, abonos, fertilizantes, etc. 


 Las compras lo  realizan  en chimbo cada tres meses.  


 Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar los cultivos para tener mejores ingresos para la familia. 



 El desafío que enfrenta es seguir trabajando para  mejorar la calidad de vida. 


En sus tiempos libres le gusta   salir a caminar con su esposo.
texts.en: Adela is 60-years-old. She is married and lives with her husband in the corner of the Chimbo providence in Bolivar. Adela works by harvesting corn, wheat, etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies, manure, and fertilizer, etc. She buys her supplies in Chimbo every three months. Her dream for the future is to improve her crops to have better income for her family. The challenge that she faces is to continue working to improve her quality of life. In her free time she likes to go for a walk with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, manure, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Jose Vicenta

texts.es:
José tiene 66 años de edad es casado  tiene dos hijos vive con su esposa y sus hijos en el Cantón Chimbo 

Provincia Bolívar.



José se dedica la compra y venta de animales.


Solicita el crédito para la compra de animales y mejorar la calidad de vida.


 Las compras lo realizan en el cantón chimbo. Su sueño es ampliar el negocio. 


 El desafío que se  enfrenta es de luchar contra cualquier problema. 


 En su tiempo libre le  gusta reírse con su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 66, is married and has 2 children.  He lives with his wife and his children in the canton of Chimbo in Bolivar province.

Jose has a business raising and selling animals.  He is requesting a loan to buy animals so that he can improve his quality of life.

He makes his purchases in the canton of Chimbo.  His dream is to expand his business.  His main challenge is to deal with the problems that come up.

In his free time, Jose likes to laugh together with his family.

loans.use: to buy animals

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is a 34-year-old business lady. She is married to Charles, and they are blessed with one child aged eight. She has been selling cereals and other farm produce for the past two years. Edita has a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD. Edita will use the loan to add a stock of rice, sorghum, maize, and beans. 

With the anticipated profits from the business, she will improve her business and educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to supply her cereals to surrounding towns, like Nairobi.

loans.use: to add a stock of rice, sorghum, maize, beans, etc.

loans.name: Kathya Denisse

texts.es:
Kathya es una mujer de 25 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y su pequeña hija, a quienes ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeña, ya que Kathya es padre y madre para ella; con mucho esfuerzo Kathya estuvo estudiando la carrera profesional de Secretariado, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar, no pudo culminar sus estudios, pero sueña con poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Kathya trabaja como empleada, brindando servicios de limpieza, lavado y otros cuidados del hogar, adicionalmente los fines de semana trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de equipos para celulares, como carcasas, memorias, cargadores, usb y otros, Kathya trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Kathya se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un mostrador y una vitrina, los cuales le servirán de mucho para exhibir mejor sus productos, de esta manera Kathya seguirá trabajando y esforzándose ya que tiene el deseo de mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Kathya is a 25-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Cañete in the Imperial district with her parents and her young daughter. She loves her daughter and she is the main purpose of her life.  She is a very nice person, hardworking, and enthusiastic. She dedicates all her effort to getting ahead in life for her young daughter. Kathya is takes the role of mother and father for her daughter. With a lot of effort, Kathya was studying a professional career to become a secretary. Unfortunately, she was not able to finish her studies because of financial problems and the fact that she had to work.  She dreams of finishing her studies. In her free time she loves to cook a very delicious carapulca with dry soup to share with her family. 

From her own initiative and with a lot of determination and dedication, she works as an employee offering cleaning services, washing, and other household services.  Additionally, on the weekends she works in her store selling cell phone equipment such as cases, memory, chargers, USB, and other items. Kathya works every day for approximately 10 hours a day. She thinks that she does well because she is responsible and because she treats people in a kind manner. 

Kathya is very grateful for the lenders on Kiva. Thanks to the help provided she can purchase a counter and show window. These will help her to exhibit her best products. This way Kathya will continue to work and strain herself because she has the desire to improve her conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase a counter and a display case

loans.name: Zaitun

texts.en: Zaitun has operated a business selling potatoes at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future to sell wholesale.The previous Kiva loan helped her to boost her business, and she earned good profit. She comes to you again for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings. She wants to purchase sacks of potatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pineapples, oranges and ripe bananas

loans.name: Keresencia

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 46-year-old Keresencia from Harare. She is widowed with one child. Keresencia produces African designs on materials for sale. The business has been in operation for three years. She says the main challenge she faces is the lack of adequate capital. 

Keresencia has requested a loan of $700 to buy more fabric and chemicals to increase her orders. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living. In the future, Keresencia plans to export her work all over the world.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and chemicals to increase her capacity to produce African designs

loans.name: Ana Karen

texts.es:
Ana es una joven de 22 años, vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú. El distrito de Parcona se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería, también se le conoce por la amabilidad de sus pobladores. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho bailar y en ocasiones le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual son los riquísimo “tallarines Rojos”. Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar administración.

Con mucho entusiasmo Ana trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos y por las noches estudia la carrera de ingeniería química, la cual puede solventar con el fruto de su trabajo con mucho esfuerzo; ella trabaja alrededor de 5 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amigable y atiende de manera amable a sus clientes.

Ana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una computadora., lo cual la ayudara para poder realizar sus trabajos y no gastar en alquiler de cabina de internet seguirá luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y ser una gran profesional”.
texts.en:
Ana is a young woman who is 22 years old. She live sin the district of Parcona, Ica Peru.  Parcona is characterized by having a hot climate as well as the agriculture and cattle farming.  Parcona is also known for the friendly townspeople.  When Ana has some free time she really likes to dance and on special occasions she likes to eat one of her favorite meals which is the very delicious “Tallarines Rojos” (red noodles). She was only able to study until secondary school, but she would have liked to study business. 

With a lot of enthusiasm, Ana works in a small business selling beauty products and cosmetics. At night she studies chemical engineering. She does this activity with the with a lot of hard work. She works about 5 hours a day and can accommodate up to 10 clients daily. She thinks that she does well with her business because she is very friendly and attentive in a kind way to her clients.

Ana is very grateful for the Kiva lenders.  The help that they provide allow her to purchase a computer. This will help her to complete her work and not waste money in going to an Internet café. She will continue working everyday to realizer her biggest dream which is to finish her career and be a successful professional.

loans.use: to purchase a computer

loans.name: Amancia

texts.en:
Amancia is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of two young children from Corella, Bohol. She has had a business making charcoal for more than 10 years now. Her husband works as a farmer.

Amancia is asking for a loan to buy more wood for making charcoal. With this loan, she will be able to produce more charcoal which she can sell to the market. In the future, Amancia hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more wood

loans.name: Zbs Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! In the center of this photo we see 32-year-old Chengetanai, who lives in the town of Gweru. She is married and the mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She also cares for two dependents. She runs a retail business selling shoes, jeans, handbags, blankets and other items. She has been in business for two years and her main challenges are many competitors, occasional low demand, and high tariffs on imported goods. Chengetanai  has requested a loan for $400 to buy more items to sell. She says the extra income generated by this loan will increase her disposable income and allow her to complete building her house. In the future, she would like to open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en: Roy is a 26-year-old gentleman, not married but supporting his school-going children. He is a livestock trader who buys and sells livestock. He learnt about KADET Ltd. from a business clinic organized by KADET for the livestock farmers in his town. He has applied for his first loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings which will assist in purchasing animal feeds. He plans to use the proceeds to help his family meet its basic needs. He hopes to be able to uplift the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married and the mother of four children who lives in Panglao, Bohol. For the last several years, she has earned a living by raising hogs. She is seeking a loan to buy more feed and food supplements for her pigs. This loan will allow her to improve her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy feed and food supplements for her pigs.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 38 years old, married and the mother of three children. She earns a living by running a store and is requesting this loan to buy more paper bags and items to sell in her boutique. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more paper bags and retail items to sell.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es: Lucinda, de 59 años de edad,esta casada y fruto de ésta unión tiene 04 hermosos hijos quienes ya son independientes, actualmente habita cómodamente  su propia casa con su esposo.La actividad que realiza Lucinda es la venta de abarrotes para eso cuenta con una tienda de comestibles instalada en su propia casa, desde donde atiende a su clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, iniciandose hace 06 años por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional.Le gusta su negocio pues le permite   estar en casa y contar con la tranquilidad de un ingreso económico, además del tiempo libre que le permite estar con su familia.Este será el segundo préstamo con kiva, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes.Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles comprará productos al por mayor  tales como azúcar, arroz,  harina, etc. buscando los mejores precios para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Lucinda is 59-years-old. She is married and from her marriage has four beautiful children who are independent.  Currently, she lives comfortably in her own home with her husband.  Lucinda works in the sale of groceries, which she sells from a stall in her own home. She attends her clients in her home, the majority of who are her neighbors.  She began her business 6 years ago because she needed additional income.  She likes her business because it allows her to stay in her home and she can count on the reoccurring income.  Apart from the free time that her business allows, she is also able to be with her family. 

This would be her second loan with Kiva. She feels grateful for the financial support to solidify her plans.  She will use the 2000 new soles to purchase wholesale products such as sugar, rice, flour etc. She is in search of the best prices to obtain the best earnings.

loans.use: to purchase products such as rice, sugar, flour and other items

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a recurring client and here she comes to you again. She has been operating a food stall business, selling from home to local neighbors. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to a café business.

With this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 31 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of six and twelve. 

She has been in her business for ten years. With the loan, she wants to buy more potatoes to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Uwashiti

texts.en:
Uwashiti is a mother of three children. She sells shoes and bed covers. She has been in the business for five years. Her husband works as a businessman. 

She has requested a loan for adding more shoes and bed covers to sell. The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and bed covers to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is married with five children and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

Deborah has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years selling to all categories of people retail. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income by selling piped water and with a retail shop. She works from home seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to own a fully stocked retail shop so as to stop selling charcoal.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is a father of five children. He is 43 years old. He sells sorghum and has been in the business for three years. 

With this loan, he wants to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Avelita

texts.en:
Avelita earns a living through her beauty services like manicures and pedicures. She is a resident of Cortes, Bohol and has been in the business for more than 8 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Avelita is asking for a loan to buy more materials for manicures and pedicures like nail cutter nippers, nail polish, and other items. With this she will be able to cater to more customers, thus increasing her earnings. 

In the future, Avelita dreams of exploring another venture to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy more materials for manicures and pedicures like nail cutter nippers, nail polish, and other items.

loans.name: Marichelle

texts.en:
Marichelle is a 29-year-old woman and has two children. They live in Corella, Bohol. She has been engaged in the charcoal-making business for more than 4 years now with her husband.

Marichelle hopes to improve her business, but she lacks the capital to do so. With this, she is asking for a loan to buy more wood and sacks. Through this loan, she is hopeful that she can increase her earnings and income.

loans.use: to buy more wood and sacks.

loans.name: Vridaus

texts.en: Vridaus is 28 years old. She is married with two children, both of whom attend school. Her husband works as a driver. She sells shoes and has been in the business for four years. The profits from the business will be used to establish a boutique in which she will sell other items.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Cesar

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Carlos se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Res para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Carlos trabaja como ayudante en una imprenta de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por una aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de sus materiales de estudios, como libros, folletos y útiles de escritorio diversos, de esta manera Carlos podrá contar con las herramientas necesarias para cursar adecuadamente sus estudios, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un buen profesional y poco a poco al lado de su familia desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 22-year-old male who is single. He lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and brothers. He is a very nice, hardworking, and enthusiastic person that has a big desire to get ahead.  Thanks to his hard work and support of his parents, Carlos is studying the professional career of Business Administration.  In his free time he likes to listen to music and in other occasions he cooks a delicious “seco de res” (steak) to share with his family. 

Through his own initiative and with determination and dedication, Carlos works as an assistant in a business in his city.  He works everyday for about 8 hours. He thinks he does well because he is responsible and kind to everyone. 

Carlos is very grateful for the lenders on Kiva. With the help provided he is able to purchase study materials such as books, folders, and office supplies.  This way he will have the necessary tools to complete his study.  He will continue to work and expend effort to complete his dream to turn himself into a successful professional and slowly get his family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase study materials

loans.name: Dora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dora, solcita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de reconstruir el local del negocio por lo que este sera de mucha ayudara para comprar los materiales necesarios  e invertir en productos para la venta. Esto le ayudara a darle una mayor imagen al negocio y así obtener mayor demanda de cliente para que estos se queden satisfechos. 
Las circunstancias familiares y las condiciones economicas se mantienen.
texts.en:
Dora is requesting a new loan to build a stall for her business. This would be very helpful to her to be able to purchase the necessary materials and invest in the products she sells. This will help give her business a better image and therefore create more demand from her clients and satisfy her clients’ needs.

The family circumstances and the economic conditions are stable.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials and invest in products to sell

loans.name: Mario Edgardo

texts.es: Don mario se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años y eso le ha dado la capasidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maiz y el sorgo, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos basicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, mario esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en:
Don Mario has been a farmer for 10 years, which has given him the ability and the necessary knowledge to manage his crops. His main crops are corn and sorghum, which are sold to dry goods companies located near his home. With the profit he earns from his sales, Mario is able to help with his family’s expenses. He lives with his wife and two children.

Mario is requesting a loan so that he can buy farming supplies that will help him with planting his crops. These items include compost, seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies. As a result, he will be able to generate more income and continue helping with the household expenses without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Cortes, Bohol. She has run a sari-sari (or variety store) business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Gertrudes is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soap and shampoo, noodles, cooking ingredients, rice and other items. With this loan, she can increase her stock and sell more to her customers. Gertrudes dreams of expanding her business and making it more productive.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soap and shampoo, noodles, cooking ingredients, rice and other items.

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en: Dancille is 32 years old. She has sold retail items for the past five years. She is married with four children. With the loan, she wants to add new items like kids' clothes and shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Angel Auelio

texts.es:
Angel tiene 36 años de edad  es divorciado vive con sus padres en el Cantón  Ventas Provincia Los Ríos.

Es integrante de ventanilla Virgen de Guadalupe  que se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche  perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Angel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, a la venta de maíz y arroz también a la crianza de animales como cerdos y ganado vacuno.

 Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno para el cultivo de maíz, trigo, y otros para el invierno. 

Las compras lo realiza en Ventanas y Quevedo. 

Su sueño es la compra de tierras para el cultivo y poner un negocio.

 El desafío que enfrenta es el cogollero y otros.
