 En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear a otro lado.
texts.en:
Angel is 36 years old, divorced, and lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas, which is in Los Ríos Province.

He is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Guadalupe”, which is in the parish of Puerto Pechiche in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. Angel is a farmer who grows and sells corn and rice. He also raises animals, such as pigs and cows.

Angel is requesting a loan so that he can pay the rent of his farmland for growing corn, wheat, and other crops for the winter. His purchases are conducted in Ventanas and Quevedo. Angel’s dreams include buying land to cultivate and starting a business. His challenges include dealing with army worms and other pests.

In his free time, Angel enjoys going for walks from one place to another.

loans.use: to pay the rent of his farmland.

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es: Rodolfo de 41 años es una persona con mucha experiencia en el trabajo que realiza, vive junto a su esposa e hijos, por quienes trabaja muy duro para que no les falte nada en el hogar. Él trabaja criando cerdos y ganado vacuno y así mismo cosecha maíz y sorgo el cual comercializa con diferentes clientes en mercados. Su negocio es bastante estable, don rodolfo solicita un préstamo para poder comprar abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas asi como lo muestra en la fotografia par poder seguir teniendo buenas cosechas y buenas ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Rodolfo, age 41, is a person who has plenty of experience in the work that he does. He lives with his wife and children, so he works very hard to make sure that they lack nothing in their home.

Rodolfo’s work involves raising pigs and cattle. He also grows corn and sorghum, which are sold to different customers at the markets. His business is reasonably stable. Don Rodolfo is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, fertilizers, and pesticides, as shown in the photograph. This will allow him to continue having good harvests and generating good earnings so that he can provide his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
Germán, se dedica a la agricultura; el vive con su familia. El oficio lo aprendio con su familia y lo realiza de lunes a sabado para asi obtener mayores ingresos. Solicita un  préstamo que le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, semilla mejorada; esta inversion le ayudara en la siembra de maíz para obtener una cosecha más alta  y estable.
Su sueños tener mejores condiciones de vida y economicas para brindarle una calidad de vida a sus seres queridos.
texts.en: Germán works in agriculture. He lives with his family. He learned this job from his family and he works from Monday to Saturday to earn more income. He is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy manure, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and improved seed. This investment will help him to have a better and more stable harvest when he plants corn. His dream is to have better living and economic conditions to provide a better quality of life for his loved ones.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and improved seed.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 40 years old. She sells vegetables and has been in the business for 15 years. She would like to add more vegetables and fruits for sale. With the loan, she would like to add more eggplant, onions and oranges. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children’s school fees. In the picture, her elder son and another young boy are seated behind her.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for sale, including oranges, eggplants and onions.

loans.name: Damarce

texts.en: Damarce is 43 years old. She is married with seven children. She sells milk and has been in the business for three years. With the loan, she wants to buy more containers for collecting milk. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more containers for collecting milk for sale.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a merchant and runs a sari-sari (or variety store) business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place in Corella, Bohol. Rosalinda has been operating her store for more than six years and it works well.

As of now, she is asking for a loan to be used as additional capital for buying groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, rice and other items. Through this loan, she can improve her stock, thus giving her the chance to sell more to her customers. In the future, Rosalinda has hopes of making her business a success and productive.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her store like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, rice and other items.

loans.name: Ornela Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Ornelia, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo que esta pequeño, trabaja haciendo recorrido escolar a niños desde muy temprano se levanta para empezar su labor, estudia la carrera de de Lic. en Derecho, profesión que le interesa mucho ejercer para brindarle apoyo jurídico a la comunidad y también ayudar económicamente con sus ingresos a la familia. Ornelia solicita el crédito para poder pagar una especialización en Derecho con Mención Empresarial.
texts.en:
Doña Ornelia is 38 years old, married, and has a young child. Her job involves transporting kids to school, so she must wake up extremely early in order to begin her work. She is also studying for a law degree since she is greatly interested in pursuing a profession in which she can provide legal advice to her community. In addition, this would allow her to help out financially with her family’s income.

Ornelia is requesting a loan so that she can pay for a specialization course in Business Law.

loans.use: to pay for a specialization course.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a single mother of four children, and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of a restaurant and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more  bunches of green bananas, beef, cowpeas, charcoal, rice and sweet and Irish potatoes. She generates additional income from selling spare parts. She works from home six days out of every week. Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked restaurant and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like bunches of green bananas, rice, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes and charcoal.

loans.name: Sulema

texts.es: Sulema nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 36 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” pues es  una persona responsable y emprendedora pues sus actividades económicas son la crianza de animales menores como chanchos, ovejas  y venta de comida, ella tiene un puesto de venta en uno de los colegios de la ciudad de Challabamba. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, aceite y otras cosas más. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en: Sulema was born in Challabamba District and she lives in the same district where she was born. Challabamba District is located in Paucartambo Province in Cusco Department, Peru. She is 36 years old and has a common-law marriage, from which she has three children. She belongs to the Virgen de Chanca communal bank. She is an enterprising and responsible person. She raises small animals like pigs and sheep, and she sells food. She has a stand in one of the the schools in the city of Challabamba. On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy merchandise like sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, noodles, oil, and other things. She is grateful to everyone for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, oil, and other things.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is aged 25. She is married with two children. They are both still too young to attend school. With the loan, she wants to buy more sewing machines to add to the existing ones. She has been selling clothes for women for five years. With the loan, she will make savings.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for use in her business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 34 years old. He is a father of five children. With the loan, he wants to buy more potatoes to sell locally. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the farming of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 26 years old. She sells beans and has been in the business for six years. With the loan, Rose would like to add more beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business of the beans.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 41-year-old married woman from Corella, Bohol and the mother of three children. She has been engaged in the charcoal making business for more than four years now. This is the source of their income.

Evangeline is asking for a loan to buy more wood and coconut shells. With this, she will be able to produce more charcoal which she can sell to the market. In the future, Evangeline hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy more wood and coconut shells

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 36 years old. She sells maize flour and has been in the business for three years. With the loan, she will buy more maize flour to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos. El está acompañado y disfruta de un hijo de cinco años de edad, tiene facilidad para pagar el crédito; este oficio que realiza de la agricultura lo hace como una fuente para generar más ingresos, siembra los granos básicos y posteriormente  después de obtener la cosecha venderlo por temporada.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar la calidad de los productos y así obtener ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Su sueño es sacar a sus hijos adelante y que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Francisco makes a living growing basic grains.  He has a partner and a five-year-old son.  He has the means to pay back this loan.  Francisco's agricultural work is a source of income.  He sows basic grains and, after the harvesting season, goes out to sell them.

This loan will allow Francisco to buy supplies, such as manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides and chemicals for preventing plagues.  The investment will improve the quality of Francisco's products and he will thus make a higher profit and improve his quality of life.

Francisco's dream is for his children to prosper and to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides and chemicals for preventing plagues, and more.

loans.name: Dúo Las Victorias De San Martin Group

texts.es:
Dúo Victorias de San Martin
Este grupo esta formado por la señora Victoria, quien tiene dos zapaterías uno en su casa y otro en la ciudad capital, vende toda clase de calzado y diseño, para niños y adultos, tennis en diferentes numeraciones y estilo,  Ella utiliza mucho capital para la compra de los zapatos la cual lo hace por cajas y le cuestan Q. 100.00 cada par. El dinero no le alcanza por eso nuevamente hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para poder comprar mas zapato y así no quedarle mal a sus clientes al momento que la busquen y compren con ella.espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
"Dúo Victorias de San Martin" group

One of this group's members is Victoria who has two shoe shops - one in her home and another in the capital city.  She sells all types and designs of footwear, for children and adults.  She also sell trainers in different styles and sizes.  Victoria uses a lot of capital to buy the shoes.  She buys the shoes in boxes, at 100 Quetzal per pair.  She does not have the money to buy shoes just now so is applying for a new loan to buy more shoes and so that her customers do not lose confidence in her when they come looking to buy from her.  Victoria hopes that you can help with this loan.

loans.use: to buy footwear in bulk.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 42 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” pues es  una persona responsable y emprendedora pues sus actividades económicas son la crianza de animales menores, ganadería, agricultura y venta de comida, ella tiene un puesto de venta de comida  en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Challabamba. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, aceite, verduras y otras cosas más. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en: Cirila was born and continue to lives in the Challabamba district.  (Challabamba is in the province of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco in Peru).  Cirila is 42 years old and has a partner.  Together they have three children.  Cirila is part of the "Virgen de Chanca" communal bank.  She is responsible and enterprising and makes a living raising young animals and cattle, in agriculture and selling foodstuffs.  Cirila has a stall in one of Challabamba's markets.  On this occasion she needs a loan to buy merchandise such as bags of rice, bags of sugar, pastas, oil, vegetables and other items.  Cirila is grateful to everybody for this loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as bags of rice, bags of sugar, pastas, oil and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and the necessary materials to build a shed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another kitchen for preparing tamales and to buy the materials to improve the hut where she works.

loans.name: Fida Hussain

texts.en:
Mr. Fida Hussain is a 34 year old. He lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with his five children and a wife.

Since 2009, he has had a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, he will purchase a variety of goods like rice, flour, milk, eggs, pulses, soap, and detergent for the store to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Mr. Fida Hussain and his family are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products for the general store.

loans.name: Saan Group

texts.en:
“Saan” (excellence), a joint liability group, was formed in the year 2010 by four active women of Khariar town of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. 

Puspanjali is one of the members of this group standing second from the left with her hand raised. She is 29 years of age and lives with her husband and one son of two and a half years. Puspanjali hails from a rural village and is now staying at Khariar in a rented house for her business and the education of her child.

Puspanjali has been running an internet cum photocopy center for the last seven years with the active help of her husband. She has engaged two people in her business in order to provide services to the customers. Apart from the internet work, they also do desktop publishing (DTP) and photo printing work. During her previous two loans from Mahashakti, Puspanjali was able to develop her business by adding an updated computer system, camera, etc. in each loan. From this business, she earns a monthly income of 8,000-10,000 INR. 

This is the third loan for Puspanjali and she wants to purchase a photocopy machine, a camera and accessories for her computer center for the smooth running of her business. She expects a good return from this investment.

Puspanjali hopes to establish an educational institute where there will be all types of educational facilities starting from nursery to post-graduation. Puspanjali says she is doing all these things for her son, who in the future will look after her business. The other three members of this group are Satarupa, Rajeswari and Puspa, who are running a restaurant, a photocopy center, and a watch center, respectively.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a photocopy machine, a camera and computer accessories

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is 81 years old. He is married with seven children. He owns a mini supermarket and has been in the business for two years. He would like to request the loan to buy more juice and mineral water to sell. He is very dedicated to making his business more prosperous. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for the better future of the business. In the picture, his daughter is working in the business.

loans.use: To buy more juice and mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Kaday

texts.en: This is 34-year-old Kaday. She is married and has three children aged one, five and ten. In 2011, Kaday established her clothing, mobile phone and caps business. She began her business because she wants to be self-reliant after dropping out of school. Her business is located in city center and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,317,000 every month from this business. She is requesting a loan of Le 5,000,000. Kaday has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional blouses, jeans and silk trousers. She hopes that this loan will improve her stock and increase her profits. In the future, Kaday plans to improve her inventory of mobile phones, and hopes to be able to open outlets throughout the town with the profit gained. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for blouses, jeans and silk trousers.

loans.name: Bashiru

texts.en: This is 48-year-old Bashiru.  He is married, and has three children aged four, eight and fifteen. He has two additional dependents, his sister’s children, which live with him and he helps with their education.  In 2010, Bashiru established his patent drugs business. The business started as a side business from the hospital job he has so he could be self-reliant. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are pregnant women, children and lactating mothers. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,653,700 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Bashiru has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional patent drugs. He hopes that this loan can increase his stock and improve the shop. In the future, Bashiru plans to improve the business and establish a dispensary, developing the business with the profit from the loan.

loans.use: to pay for medical drugs to increase the inventory in his pharmacy.

loans.name: Ilyas Masih

texts.en:
Mr. Ilyas Masih is a 31-year-old man. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He has been running a motorbike repair shop in a local market. He has three years of excellent experience in this work. He is the elder son of his parents and he has to shoulder all the expenses and responsibilities of his family alone. This shop is the only source of income for his family. He is a married man and has 1 child. He has to look after his parents, siblings, and his wife and child alone. He is a very hardworking and responsible person. 

Presently he has requested a loan for the amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to buy motor bike spare parts such as brake shoes, tyre tubes, clutches, brake levers, foot rests, wheels etc. This will help him to grow his business and net savings for the future. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy motor bike spare parts for the shop.

loans.name: Sakeena Group

texts.en:
Sakeena is a 49-year-old responsible housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and six children. Her husband has run a plumbing business for six years. As a member of a two person lending group, Sakeena has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy new tools for his plumbing work. He would purchase hammers, screwdrivers, PVC Pipes, threads, grease and other plumbing tools for his work.
Sakeena would pay the educational expenses of her children with the profit amount and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for such kindness.
NOTE: In the picture Sakeena is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing tools.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 29-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol and a mother of a seven-year-old son. Edna has been engaged in the basket-weaving business for more than four years now. This is the source of her income. She is asking for a loan to buy materials for basket weaving like buri, wicker, straw and others. With this, she will be able to weave more, thus increasing her products to sell in the market. 

Edna dreams of improving her ventures and saving money for the schooling of her son.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket weaving like buri, wicker, straw and others.

loans.name: Miniru

texts.en:
This is twenty-eight-year-old Miniru.  He is married, and has two children aged three and six. He has one additional dependent who lives with him to help his brother with his education. 

In 2007, Miniru established his provisions, drinks, toiletries, and recharge card business. He began his business because he wanted to be self reliant after dropping out of school. His business is located in the outskirts and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,300,200 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Miniru has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional soft drinks, cigarettes and mayonnaise. He hopes that this loan can improve the stock and raise the profit. In the future, Miniru plans to open an outlet in the center of town. With the loan the goods would increase, he hopes to be able to continue with his education and improve the business. He started as a gari vendor, and now with the loans he has received from ARD, he now has a provision shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for soft drinks, cigarettes and mayonnaise

loans.name: Fatmata Jabbie

texts.en: This is 49-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has three children aged five, eighteen and twenty-four. She has her younger sister's two children living with her as well. She helps with their education. In 1998, Fatmata established her gara and batik business. She began her business because she wants to be self-reliant after graduating from a technical vocational school. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,463,900 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy additional brillion, ink and caustic soda. She hopes that this loan can increase her production and improve the stock. In the future, Fatmata plans to establish a training school on gara tie dyeing for young girls, and hopes to produce more and make a larger profit. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for brillion, ink and caustic soda to produce gara tie dyed cloth.

loans.name: Momodu

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Momodu.  He is married and has three children aged two, six and nine. 

In 2003, Momodu established his provisions, bread and drinks business. He started the business to be self-reliant. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about 1,725,000 SLL every month. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,500,000 SLL. Momodu requires a loan in order to buy eggs, provisions, and powdered milk. 

In the future, Momodu plans to open another store at the center of town.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for eggs, provisions, and rice.

loans.name: Ansata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé lors de la mise en place du banc villageois, il est composé de femmes d’une même concession, de même il porte le nom du chef de concession. Ces femmes mènent des activités communes que ce soit le petit commerce ou le maraichage.

Madame Ansata (debout à l’extrême droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants, elle prend aussi en charge deux parents venus étudier au Collège du village. Elle fait du maraichage, les récoltes sont vendues dans les marchés hebdomadaires et au village.

Ce nouveau prêt elle l’utilisera dans l’achat de semence et d’engrais pour la culture de piment et autres légumes.

Les bénéfices générés par l’activité servent à améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille sur le plan sanitaire, scolaire et de la nourriture.
texts.en:
This group was created during the inauguration of the Banc Villageois.  It consists of women who come from the same "concession" (a group of houses on a small plot of land).  The group's name, Ansata, is also the name of the leader of the "concession".  The women from this group share common activities such as retail or market farming.

Ansata (standing at the far right in the photo) is the group's featured borrower.  She is married and the mother of six children.  She also supports two relatives who have come to study at the village's middle school.  Ansata is involved in market farming.  She sells her crops at weekly markets and in her village.

She will use this new loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to grow pimiento and other vegetables.

The profits from her business are used to improve her family's health situation as well as its nutritional and educational conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to grow pimiento and other vegetables.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is 54 years old and a hardworking, diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and five children. Her husband has been running a business selling gem stones for 10 years. He has a shop in the main market of the city. Khursheed has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the loan, her husband wants to purchase a new variety of rare gem stones. This would attract more customers and his sales would be increased. After getting the profit, Khursheed would pay installments on the loan and save some money for the marriage of her children.

loans.use: To purchase rare gems and stones for her husband's shop

loans.name: Sana Group

texts.en:
Sana is a 26-year-old responsible mother of  three children. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and children. Her husband is a janitor in a hospital but his salary is not enough to meet the family's household expenses. He wants to start his own rickshaw business. 
As a member of a two-person group, Sana has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband would purchase a rickshaw from the loan amount and he would drive the rickshaw at night while keeping his present job. In this way, his monthly income would be increased and they would be able to send their children to schools.Sana is very hopeful for this loan and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.
NOTE: In the picture Sana is raising her hand

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw

loans.name: Sidra Group

texts.en:
Sidra is 23 years old and a young and energetic women. She is an educated and well-mannered responsible mother of one son. Her husband is working in a government organization. For a better future for her son, she has been running a part-time business of selling ladies shoes from her house.
As a member of two-person group, Sidra has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to open a shop in the market to run her business properly as she is not getting enough customers in her house. She would also purchase new varieties of shoes for her shop and in this way she would expand her business.
With the profit, she would send her son to the best school in town. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping her. 
NOTE : In the picture Sidra is raising her hand

loans.use: To purchase variety of shoes for her shop

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 43-year-old responsible mother of five children. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband, two daughters and three sons. Her husband is a taxi driver and all of her sons are currently unemployed. They are facing a lot of financial problems in life.
Rukhsana has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband could buy a rickshaw for their sons. This could increase their monthly income and savings and her sons would be working to help their father. Rukhsana is very hopeful that the loan would be productive for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ruqia is 27 years old and is a diligent and hardworking women living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and three daughters. Her husband is government employee and all of her children are currently studying in schools. Her husband’s monthly income is not enough to meet the household and educational expenses of their children. They are living in a rented house and she desires to have her own house as they have to pay very high rent every month. 
Ruqia helps her husband by selling clothes for the last five years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to buy new varieties of clothes toexpand her business. With the profit, she wants to pay the educational expenses of her children and save some money for the future. Ruqia is very hopeful that the loan would be productive for them. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: To purchase new varieties of clothes

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Hawa. She is married and has three children aged seven, twelve and 23. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to help with the house chores. 

In 2007, Hawa established her provision, toiletries, drinks and African-dress business. She began her business because she wants to help her retired husband to run the affairs of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are adults of all sexes. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,589,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Hawa has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional mayonnaise, powdered milk and laundry soap. She hopes that this loan can increase stock and raise more profit. In the future, Hawa plans to expand the business to trade imported rice. She also hopes to be able to care for her children's education. If given more loan opportunities, she shall establish more outlets. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more provisions, drinks, toiletries, and textiles to sell.

loans.name: Subba

texts.en:
This is forty-three-year-old Subba. He is married, and has three children aged four, five and ten. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to help with the household chores. In 1994, Subba established his used bags business. He began his business after coming from his village as a result of the war to be self-reliant. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 3,983,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of an amount of SLL 5,000,000. Subba has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional school bags and traveling bags. He hopes that this loan will increase the stock and improve the business. 

In the future, Subba plans to move to a shop and improve the business, he also plans to add more stock and get more profit with the loan. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for used bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastic slippers and ladies' shoes.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
This is thirty-seven-year-old Amadu. He is married, and has two children aged four and eight. In 2006, Amadu established his auto spare parts business. 

He began his business because he wants to be self-reliant after dropping out of school. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are mechanics and motorbike riders. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,607,750 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of an amount of SLL 4,000,000. Amadu requires a loan in order to pay for additional engine oil. He hopes that this loan can increase the stock and raise the profit. In the future, Amadu plans to improve his sales of engine oil and hopes to be able to open outlets within the town.

loans.use: to pay for engine oil.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is thirty-two-year-old Ibrahim. He is married, and has three children aged one, four and eight. In 2011, Ibrahim established his provision, toiletries and drinks business. The business started after he left his village to be self-reliant. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are all ages. 

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,288,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of an amount of SLL 3,000,000. Ibrahim requires a loan in order to pay for additional soft drinks, biscuits and chocolates. He hopes that this loan will improve and increase the stock. In the future, Ibrahim plans to expand his business to the sale of pure water and he hopes to see the business move from a kiosk to a shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for soft drinks, biscuits and chocolates.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en: Nonita is a basket weaver from Antequera, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 10 years. Her husband works as a carpenter. Nonita works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children. Nonita is asking for a loan to buy buri (native palm), wicker and straw. With this, she will be able to weave more baskets to sell.

loans.use: to buy buri, wicker and straw for her weaving business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Elizabeth. She is single and has two children ages 6 and 14. In 2010, Elizabeth established her food and drink business. The business started after she graduated from a technical vocational school to be self reliant. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are adults. 

Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about 1,327,900 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of  3,000,000. SLL Elizabeth requires a loan in order to pay for additional drinks, rice and oil. She hopes that this loan will increase the stock and improve the business.

In the future, Elizabeth plans to expand the business to include provisions and toiletries and she also hopes to support her children's education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks, rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 51 year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has five children ages 25, 24, 21, 18 and 15. She has one additional dependent who lives with her as her sales girl. In 2003, Fatmata established her commercial business. She began her business just to provide help to her husband in the running of the home. Her business is located at the center of town and her main customers are men and women. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 700,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 6,250,000 SLL. Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid three loans and now requires a new loan in order to  buy Irish potatoes (1,500,000 SLL), soft drinks (800,000 SLL) and eggs (3,000,000 SLL). She hopes that with this loan and the additional income generated by the loan she will be able to her solve her problems. In the future, Fatmata plans to build a house, to give her children a quality education and to travel to the holy land of Mecca. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy provisions and soft drinks.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: This is 44-year-old Memuna.  She is married and has three children ages 19, 15 and 12. She has one additional dependent who lives with her for schooling. In 2007, Memuna established her commercial timber business. She began her business just to enable her to adequately support her children. Her business is located at the outskirts of town and her main customers are both men and women. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Memuna has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy timber. She hopes that this loan will enable her to buy more stock and improve her stock level. In the future, Memuna plans to own a timber processing factory, to own a house and to own an outlet in the middle of town. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more timber.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: This is 29-year-old Salamatu. She is married and has one child, age 12. She has three additional dependents who live with her because their father is deceased. In 2003, Mariatu established her home products business selling plastic pans and dishes. She began her business just to enable her to take care of her child. Her business is located in the heart of town and her main customers are both men and woman. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 650,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Mariatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy set pans (1,000,000 SLL), rubber buckets (1,200,000 SLL) and flasks (800,000 SLL). She hopes that this loan will increase her stock level. In the future, Mariatu plans to build a house, to give her child a quality education and to open a branch at the Kenema plaza. She is saying thanks to Kiva

loans.use: To buy plastic dishes and pans

loans.name: Bainadu

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Bainadu. She is married and has four children aged 23, 20, 17 and 14. In 2007, Bainadu established her commercial business. She began her business just to enable her to adequately support her children. Her business is located in the middle of town and her main customers are mostly women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 6,250,000. Bainadu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bulgar wheat for SLL 3,000,000, garrie for SLL 2,000,000 and cornflour for SLL 1,000,000. She hopes that this loan will increase her income level. 

In the future, Bainadu plans to complete the construction of her home and to support her children’s education. She is saying thanks to you for your support.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell.

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank “Shalom”, meaning peace is located in the western Guatemalan highland town of Olintepque Quetzaltenango. The ladies are about to take their second loan from Friendship Bridge and this is also their second loan cycle trough KIVA. In the previous loan cycle, there were 9 women in the Trust Bank. However, for this new loan cycle, there are two additional members bringing the total to eleven business women. Their average age is 34 years and each has an average of four children. The capital from the new loan cycle will be used to boost the productivity of their businesses which will not only be valuable to them but also to their families and the community.

In the first loan cycle, we reported about a young 25-year-old woman named Olivia. Because of her loan and her diligent efforts, she was able to increase her business, keep her two boys in school and enroll herself in the 5th grade which she attends over the weekends. Olivia is eagerly awaiting another micro loan!

Brenda is an 18-year-old single mother of a beautiful daughter who is 14 months old. She was only able to attend school until the 7th grade as she had to take care of her daughter and needed to work to support herself and her daughter. In thinking of the future of her baby girl, she thought carefully about what she wanted to pursue and decided to begin to sell fruit. She works seven days per week and happily, the business is growing and doing well. Brenda wants to inject more capital into her business and for that reason; she is applying for her first loan from Friendship Bridge. She looks forward to purchasing more fruit and increasing her inventory.

The Trust Bank “Shalom” appreciates the confidence and support of KIVA investors not only for this second loan but also for the previous one. Brenda sums it up when she says, "We are aware of the commitment we have made and will carry out our responsibilities positively and successfully.”

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Arca De Noe Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank “Arca de Noe” or Noah’s Ark is located in the busy commercial neighborhood of San Antonio, Quetzaltenango Guatemala. It was formed three years ago and consists of ten members. Three of the ladies are new to the group and are quite excited about the possibilities that they will have with a loan and some education. Most of the women are engaged in selling food such as tortillas and bakery items, or are owners of small shops selling items for daily consumption.

Roselia is a 49-year-old new member of the Trust Bank. She is divorced and lives alone with her eight children. Four of the children are still in school. Rosalia owns a small shop where she sells items for daily consumption. She started her business with only 500 GTQ or $65 U.S. The business has increased and covers the expenses for the family to sustain itself and for the children’s education.

Roselia is requesting a loan from Friendship Bridge to stock her store. She will buy items like rice, beans, oil, sugar, pasta, salt, juices and much more to meet the demand of her customers. As the business is successful, it can grow more with financial capital. Rosalia’s dream for the future is to move her store to a more central location so she can increase her income with more customers.

The women of the Trust Bank, “Arca de Noe”, appreciate the support of the group.They share their joys and sorrows together. They know that micro-credit is a huge support because it helps them and their families. They also enjoy the monthly trainings that Friendship Bridge provides with topics like women's health, women's rights, empowerment, and business management. Roselia states, “I am eager to learn more, because I only had one year of education as my parents believed that learning to write my name was enough school for me.” Roselia and her fellow Trust Bank members are facing a brighter future because of their association with KIVA and Friendship Bridge.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 32-year-old married man and a father to four sons and three daughters. Marwan is living a modest life with his family in Jabalia refugee camp. He is employed and gets small salary, which is barely enough to cover his family's needs.

Marwan is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve living conditions in his house. Taking this loan will offer Marwan and his family members comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

Marwan is photographed in his house.

loans.use: To buy new living room furniture.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Salamatu. She is married and has one child aged eight. In 2005, Salamatu established her clothing business. She began her business just to empower herself. Her business is located in the heart of town and her main customers are both men and woman. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 300,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Salamatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy SLL 1,500,000 of waxed cotton and SLL 1,500,000 of local cotton. She hopes that this loan will enable her to start traveling to Guinea for business. 

In the future, Salamatu plans to move from her current location to a more attractive one and she also plans to secure a plot of land. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her shop.

loans.name: Viva

texts.en: Viva is a 44-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taros, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Viva has requested a loan to purchase weed spray and a shovel. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, she will support her family and kids and hopes to extend and improve her plantation.

loans.use: to buy weed spray and a shovel.

loans.name: Ahmet

texts.en:
Ahmet is a villager from southern Albania. He is known for the quantity and quality of dried onions and potatoes he produces, and was recently selected to be part of the integrated projects. He is very poor, yet he practices faith to help him cope with poverty, he said.
Ahmet is 55 and married with two children, ranging from 15 to 11 years of age. Six years back, he started planting and selling agricultural products in the nearby city’s market. Sometimes buyers buy large quantities of products from him and other villagers. The loan Ahmet is requesting at the moment will be used to buy seeds for seasonal planting. “The loan I was qualified for is a very small one, but what I will get in return will be a great help for my family”, he said.

loans.use: To buy seeds for seasonal planting

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a 50-year-old married woman with 11 children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taros, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Emilia has requested a loan to purchase weed sprayer, fertilizer, gloves and a shovel.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, she will support her family and kids and hopes to extend and improve her plantation.

loans.use: to buy gloves, a shovel, weed sprayer and fertilizer.

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en:
Saeed who appears in the photo, is a 29-year-old married young man and a father to two sons and two daughters. Saeed is employed in a local university and earns small salary, which is almost enough to cover the family's needs.

Saeed is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture and bedroom furniture in order to improve living conditions in his house. Taking this loan will offer Saeed and his family comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To buy new living room and bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Faatutu

texts.en:
Faatutu is a 35-year-old woman who is married with four children. She has a small business, providing lawn mower services to her community. She has been in this business for four years.

Faatutu needs a loan to improve the quality of her business. She will use her profits to support her family and kids. Faatutu joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy weed eater, gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Gentjan

texts.en: Gentjan is an Egyptian Albanian who wants to buy used shoes and clothes to resell. A little loan of 70,000 Albanian Lek will help him buy the items he needs. Gentjan is a 35-year-old hard-worker and married father of four children with the oldest one being 15 and the youngest 1 year old. Unlike other members of his community who live in the outskirts of major cities, he and his family have settled in a village near a major city in central Albania. At the same time as he has been buying and selling second hand items, he has been working full time in metallurgy. “I want to educate my children. It is my dream. My wife is a stay-at-home mother and I am the only one to bring an income home. I love working hard,” said Gentjan.

loans.use: to buy used shoes and clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Kavtar

texts.en:
Kavtar is a 47-year-old mother  of four. When her children were young she got beauty treatment training and planned on one day opening her business. She has opened a treatment salon in a beautiful area near her home. Kavtar has taken care with details and ensures top treatments for her clients. She is working to develop a top salon that provides a diversity of treatment and services.

Kavtar needed this loan to assist with purchasing specific treatment devices.

She plans on further expanding her business and becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: To assist with purchasing specific treatment devices.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old married young man and a father of two daughters. Mohammad is employed and gets a low salary, which is just barely enough to cover his family's needs.
Recently, Mohammad and his family moved to live in a new house, they don't have some home appliances such as a fridge and stove.
Mohammad is requesting a $2,100 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new fridge and stove.
Taking this loan will offer Mohammad and his family suitable home appliances so they can enjoy living in their new house.

loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator and stove

loans.name: Taei

texts.en: Taei is a 44 year old woman who is married with 6 children. She runs a sewing business in her community. She has 5 years of experience in this business. Taei has requested a loan to purchase a new sewing machine and sewing related materials. She plans to use her profits to support her business and also her family and kids. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, material, thread, and needles

loans.name: Falconerie

texts.en:
Falconerie is a 65-year-old married woman from Ubay Bohol. She has two grown children. She operates a retail store. She sells basic commodities like sugar, noodles, canned goods, seasonings, beverages and toiletries. She has been operating a retail store for 10 years. 

She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy additional goods to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, eggs, and frozen products. Falconerie would like to expand her business to support her family's daily needs  as well as to save for her old age.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, eggs, and frozen products.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is 31 years old, married with three children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a retail business selling rice in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over three years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

She joined in GDMPC in the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase a new weight scale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new weight scale.

loans.name: Mayra Ivette

texts.es: La joven Mayra, ahora es madre de familia de una hermosa niña de 1 año de edad un motivo más en la vida para buscar cómo salir adelante a pesar de sus bajos ingresos, con su esposo se ayuda para pagar los gastos del hogar y la manutención de su niña, ahora su esposo también es docente de una escuela primaria al igual que ella. Este crédito que solicita Mayra es para comprar materiales para continuar la construcción de su casita que todavía le falta mucho a como se puede apreciar en la imagen, pero tiene la esperanza y el deseo de terminarla pronto, ya que la familia está creciendo.
texts.en: Mayra is a young woman and now is the mother of a family, with a beautiful daughter who is 1 year old. Her daughter gives her extra motivation to continue her struggle to get ahead in life despite her low income. Mayra and her husband both contribute to looking after their daughter and to the household bills. Her husband has also gotten a job teaching in a primary school like Mayra. The loan that she is requesting is to buy materials to continue the construction of their little house, as there is a long way to go as you can see in the photo. But Mayra hopes and wishes to finish it soon because her family is growing.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, steel, gravel and blocks

loans.name: Alisi

texts.en:
Alisi is a 46-year-old married woman with 5 children. 
She has a vegetable garden where she grows cabbage, pumpkin, carrots, cucumbers, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. Alisi has requested a loan to improve the quality of her garden produce. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Alisi hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, weed sprayer and gloves

loans.name: Hussam

texts.en:
Hussam is a 21-year-old single young man, he lives with his family in modest living conditions in a refugee camp near Bethlehem. For the past three years, Hussam has had an internet cafe, it is located in a good area and has many loyal customers, making his project a profitable one and the only source of income for him. But, he needs more support to cover the cost of expansion and improvements.
Hussam is requesting a $1,500 USD Youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing additional computers. This will allow him to expand the scope of his work, improve his business, and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy more computers

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Joaquina, from the city of Los Alcarrizos, is one of the members taking a housing loan. This is her eighth loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had her business for over seven years, having started it with her own savings. Her latest loan was invested in the business, where she sells decoration items.

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business, and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house, at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings.

Joaquina wants to start building her house with this loan. She is needing to improve her house condition, since they are living in a deteriorated home structure, and she is taking this loan for that purpose. So now she is requesting this loan to buy cement and concrete blocks to start building her house walls. 

Joaquina wishes to have a safe and nice home, also to have a vocational school to teach people to decorate and make crafts. She thanks God, Esperanza Internacional, and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, thanks to all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 47 years old. She lives in Vanadzor city with her son who is a student at the Armenian State Economical University. Rita has a higher education but has never worked in her specialty. She brought up her son alone and that period coincided with the Soviet Union's collapse in Armenia. It was a most difficult period in Rita’s life. There was no gas, water or flour for bread and Armenia was under an economic blockade. Rita was jobless but she overcame that period heroically. 

Rita decided to run her own production business. She started to produce traditional Armenian meat products: basturma and sujukh (Armenian special sausages). In production Rita uses only fresh meat which she purchases on the wholesale markets of Vanadzor city.  The special preparation techniques and secrets of basturma and sujukh Rita has learned from her grandmother. Rita's meat products are very famous and popular in Vanadzor city and Lori area. 

After 20 years she has a large number of customers who prefer to buy meat products from Rita, because they have a unique taste and aroma. The meat production income allows Rita to meet her little family's needs and to pay for her son’s education. Rita is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams from Kiva lenders in order to buy a large quantity of beef for her meat production. She hopes to enlarge her business and to deliver her products to Yerevan for selling.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of beef for her meat production.

loans.name: Peka

texts.en:
Peka is 66-year-old married woman with 10 children. She runs a small business selling fish, octopus and sea cucumbers in her community and has been doing this for more than three years. 

Peka has requested a loan to buy a fishing boat, spears and a fishing net. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Peka will improve her business, support her family and support her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for a fishing boat, spears, a fishing net and fishing gear.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 27 years old. He was born in Goravan village in the Ararat region.
Arman is married and now lives with his wife, two children and mother in Vedi city which is in the Ararat region. After his military service in the Armenian army, Arman went to work in Russia and tried to meet his family needs from abroad. But after some years which he spent far from his motherland, he decided to return to Armenia, get married and start a new life in his native country.
Arman is a good blacksmith and welder. He has done this for more than 7 years and has a good reputation in the region. Arman very easily makes gates, various metal items, railings and many other useful things. He thinks all blacksmiths and welders should be creative, which helps them create and build interesting and unique things that are always different from the works of other masters. Arman is very pleased with his profession and is able to meet his families needs and take care of his mother. 
Arman requests a 400,000 Armenian dram loan to buy a few necessary tools and raw material for his blacksmith business.

loans.use: To buy a few necessary tools and raw materials for his blacksmith business.

loans.name: Ruzan

texts.en:
Ruzan is a student at the Armenian Pedagogical University. She is a future teacher of geography. Ruzan is 20 years old and lives in Sevan city with her parents and sister. Her family are engaged in farming and cattle breeding in Sevan region. 

Ruzan’s big dream is to become a good specialist and to teach a good generation in her lovely city of Sevan. As she confessed, many people from her region are abroad working but she decided to stay in her motherland and after finishing her education to work in the schools of Sevan city. She says that her city needs a good specialists. 

Ruzan needs a loan of 110,000 Armenian drams to pay her tuition fees for her last semester. She hopes to start working as a teacher of geography in September.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fees for her last semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is a married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has two children. The youngest child is 19 while the oldest is 30. She is engaged in a barbeque vending business. She sells chicken and pork barbecue to customers in her community. She has been selling barbecue for ten years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy chicken and pork meat, sauces, bamboo sticks and charcoal. Flordeliza would like to invest to other businesses to support her family as well as to send her youngest child to college.

loans.use: to buy chicken and pork meat, sauces, bamboo sticks and charcoal

loans.name: Roxene

texts.en:
Roxene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling fruit in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell in her food stall. Roxene successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Roxene's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Chesang

texts.en:
Chesang lives in the Litein area of Kenya, an area known for high production of milk. She has 4 children and has been a farmer for 5 years.  Her primary income sources are from milk and eggs. She stated that the most enjoyable aspect of farming was grazing the cows. Her biggest challenge is tilling the land. The pictured animal's name is Chepkuinet. 
Chesang was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied that they have low rates.  Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Chesang replied that her family's income will increase. As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Chesang owns the following: 'cows and poultry' but does not own 'a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV or DVD player.
Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
This is Christine, 33, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is single and happy. She is helping her parents to provide income for their whole family.

Christine operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Christine hopes to expand her business.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Febe

texts.en:
Febe is 39 years old and married with one child who is in school, Febe works very hard to provide for them.

Febe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc.

Febe has been in this business for four years.

In the future Febe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, shampoo and canned goods.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 52 years old and married with six children. Rosie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling beauty products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of beauty products to sell.

Rosie has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for one year and also earns an income from selling prepaid mobile plans. Rosie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of beauty products to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
This is Margarita, age 60, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She, with the help of her children, works to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Margarita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Margarita hopes that her business will be very successful and dreams of having a better standard of living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Erene

texts.en:
Erene is 61 years old, married and has five children. 

Erene is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Erene requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Erene has been pig-fattening for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Erene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of nine children, Leonora works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening.  Leonora is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more grocery items like canned goods, snack foods, spices, soft drinks, etc to sell in her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and pig-fattening business.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items like canned goods, snack foods, spices and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is 37 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lilit has a shell-craft business in the Philippines. Lilit requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her shell-craft business.

Lilit has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Lilit would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her shell-craft business.

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of bananas to sell. Emilda has been in this business for 15 years. Emilda also earns income from buying and selling charcoal and firewood.

Emilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of bananas to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 33 years old with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Veronica is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Veronica has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 61 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines. Thelma is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

Thelma has been pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from rice-retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 58 years old, married with one child. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a business selling fruits and vegetables in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over nine years and earns 3,000 PHP every month. 

She joined in GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional food to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional food to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 44 years old and married with one child who is in school, Cecilia works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia runs a rice-retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for four years.

In the future Cecilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Kakda

texts.en:
A young man residing in Battambang province, Kakda is 23 years old and works in a local organization in order to deal with the daily cost of living. He has occupied this job for three years. 

Kakda wants to build up his skills, so he decided to take a first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He will spend this entire loan amount to pay for his university tuition fees; he is majoring in English. He hopes that this loan will provide him sufficient capital to cover his education costs, so he can obtain a job with higher position and make more income to improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia is 50 years old and married with three children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. She has been in her business for more than six years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.en:
Bernardina is 53 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Bernardina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from direct selling of Avon products.

Bernardina is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 49 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. Corazon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to re-stock her store with food and household goods like soap, canned goods, snack foods, and noodles to sell.

Corazon has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Corazon aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to re-stock her store with food and household goods like soap, canned goods, snack foods, and noodles

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her variety store, thus generating more income. The loan also helped with her children's education and in her family's household expenses. Arlene has had this business for 12 years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Arlene would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Arlene dreams that her children will finish their studies, and she hopes for continuous growth in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and it is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory

loans.name: Jeanlie

texts.en:
Jeanlie is a 34-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She is a mother of 6 children. The oldest child is 16 while the youngest is 4.

She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items such as sugar, noodles, soaps, shampoo and beverages. Her husband works as a collector in a private company. His income is very meager to sustain the daily needs of the family.

Jeanlie requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy additional stock like canned goods, assorted soft drinks and vegetables. In the future Jeanlie would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to finance her children's education.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods,  assorted soft drinks and vegetables

loans.name: Aurita

texts.en:
This is Aurita. Her previous loan was a big help for her business. She was able to buy and sell more ready-to-wear products and she was able to generate more income. She has been in this business for six years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear products like clothes for men and women. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Aurita dreams to have her own stall easily seen by people and hopes to have their own house. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional inventory such as ready-to-wear men's and women's clothes

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is from the village of Aurora, Alicia. She is 34 years old and is happily married to Federico. The couple had been blessed with three children.
